name: bodies_in_flux_002
description: Gödel's completeness theorem implies that a statement is provable using a set of axioms if and only if that statement is true, for every model of the set of axioms. That means that for any unprovable statement, there has to be a model of those axioms for which the statement is false. // a series on how we co-produce knowledge beyond the human gaze // PNG 5000 x 5000 px
